channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Blasts from military weapons may injure the brain through its blood vessels
item.description: When military personnel fire certain powerful weapons, they may be exposed to blast waves that damage blood vessels in the brain.
item.content:encoded:
When military personnel fire certain powerful weapons, they may be exposed to blast waves that damage blood vessels in the brain.

(Image credit: Stocktrek Images/Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Jon Hamilton

item.title: This scientist studies climate change. Then the Los Angeles fire destroyed his home
item.description: Climate scientist Ben Hamlington works on understanding the impacts of climate change. Losing his house in the Eaton Fire has given that work new meaning.
item.content:encoded:
Climate scientist Ben Hamlington works on understanding the impacts of climate change. Losing his house in the Eaton Fire has given that work new meaning.

(Image credit: Ryan Kellman)
item.dc:creator: Lauren Sommer

item.title: Couples wed as landmark same-sex marriage law takes effect in Thailand
item.description: Hundreds of same-sex couples tied the knot across Thailand on Thursday, as the country becomes the first in Southeast Asia to legally recognize equal marriage.
item.content:encoded:
Hundreds of same-sex couples tied the knot across Thailand on Thursday, as the country becomes the first in Southeast Asia to legally recognize equal marriage.

(Image credit: Chanakarn Laosarakham)
item.dc:creator: Adam Hancock

item.title: This economist survived a wildfire. Now she's taking on California's insurance crisis
item.description: An economist's harrowing escape from fire, and her big ideas to rescue California from its insurance doom spiral.
item.content:encoded:
An economist's harrowing escape from fire, and her big ideas to rescue California from its insurance doom spiral.

(Image credit: San Francisco Chronicle/Hearst Newspapers)
item.dc:creator: Greg Rosalsky

item.title: Postcards From The Border aims to challenge dominant portrayal of U.S.-Mexico border
item.description: Challenging perceptions of the US-Mexico border: A new Texas art project uses music, photos and storytelling to highlight the the rich cultural tapestry beyond headlines of migration and enforcement
item.content:encoded:
Challenging perceptions of the US-Mexico border: A new Texas art project uses music, photos and storytelling to highlight the the rich cultural tapestry beyond headlines of migration and enforcement

(Image credit: Joel Salcido)
item.dc:creator: John Burnett

item.title: In a surprise, U.S. colleges saw higher enrollment last fall
item.description: The number of students in undergraduate and graduate programs rose above pre-pandemic levels for the first time.
item.content:encoded:
The number of students in undergraduate and graduate programs rose above pre-pandemic levels for the first time.

(Image credit: The Washington Post)
item.dc:creator: Elissa Nadworny

item.title: Trump calls DEI programs 'illegal' and 'immoral'. Here's how he's ending them
item.description: President Trump has issued sweeping executive actions swiftly ending diversity, equity, inclusion and accessibility programs within the federal government. Already, the work is underway.
item.content:encoded:
President Trump has issued sweeping executive actions swiftly ending diversity, equity, inclusion and accessibility programs within the federal government. Already, the work is underway.

(Image credit: Jim Watson)
item.dc:creator: Andrea Hsu

item.title: Stick with us: Why the internet is obsessed with one of the simplest tools known to man
item.description: "Stick Nation" is a worldwide movement that thrives on irreverent, fantastical and downright wholesome descriptions of sticks.
item.content:encoded:
"Stick Nation" is a worldwide movement that thrives on irreverent, fantastical and downright wholesome descriptions of sticks.

(Image credit: Jackson Hoget)
item.dc:creator: Alina Hartounian

item.title: U.N. chief warns gangs could overrun Haiti's capital without additional support
item.description: U.N. Secretary-General Antonio Guterres said in a report that gangs in Haiti could overrun the capital, leading to a complete breakdown of government, without additional international support.
item.content:encoded:
U.N. Secretary-General Antonio Guterres said in a report that gangs in Haiti could overrun the capital, leading to a complete breakdown of government, without additional international support.

(Image credit: Jean Feguens Regala)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: RFK Jr. plans to keep a financial stake in lawsuits against the drugmaker Merck
item.description: RFK Jr. plans to keep collecting referral fees in lawsuits against the drug company Merck even if confirmed as HHS secretary, according to new filings with the Office of Government Ethics.
item.content:encoded:
RFK Jr. plans to keep collecting referral fees in lawsuits against the drug company Merck even if confirmed as HHS secretary, according to new filings with the Office of Government Ethics.

(Image credit: Bloomberg)
item.dc:creator: Sydney Lupkin
